title: Running Perp-maker for Profits and Fun: Part 1
body:
[Perp-maker](https://github.com/perpetual-protocol/perp-maker) is an open-source market-making template for [Perpetual Protocol v2](https://app.perp.com/?utm_source=perp_mirror&utm_medium=blog_post), the most popular dApp on [Optimism](https://www.optimism.io/apps/defi) *(a layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum)*. Anyone can use or modify the template to facilitate trades on the protocol and earn fees.

In this tutorial, we’ll go over what Perpetual Protocol is, the risks and rewards associated with running the bot, and how to run it locally. Due to the length of this article, we’ll cover how to run the bot on AWS and further modification suggestions in part 2. Stay tuned!

## Perpetual Protocol 101

First thing first, what is Perpetual Protocol?

Perpetual Protocol is a decentralized derivative exchange (DEX) where traders can use USDC *(a USD-pegged stablecoin)* to speculate on cryptocurrency’s price movement with up to 10x leverage. At the time of writing, the DEX supports 17 markets, including BTC, ETH, ATOM, BNB, and more! You can learn how it works in detail by watching this [10-minute video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pBoKtkoNZEY) or reading [this article](https://cryptotesters.com/blog/perp-protocol).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6KeGLlSsa-3SOSv_-S-k1.png?height=806&width=1370)

### But What does “Market-making” Mean?

Whenever a trade happens, there will always be two sides involved - a taker and a maker. The takers initiate a trade, and the makers provide the inventory to let the taker take.

Here is a real-life example. When buying a fish from a vendor, you’re the taker of this trade as you’re the one that takes what the vendor supplies. As for the vendor, he is the maker of this trade as he prepares the inventory (fish in this example) that makes this trade possible.

Similarly, being a market-maker, or “maker,” on Perp v2 means you [provide the liquidity](https://blog.perp.fi/how-to-provide-liquidity-on-perp-v2-9064ed085d7f) (the assets) that traders can take, making the market viable. In return, you receive 80% of the transaction fees paid by the trader. For instance, if a trader opens a long position and this trade happens in the price range you set, you act as the other side of the trade - i.e., opening a short position as a result, and vice versa.

Makers on Perp v2 can choose the price range to which they provide liquidity. For instance, in the screenshot below, this user wants to provide liquidity to the BTC market with a price range of $9,991.99 to $60,081.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Hb5f4JjKvWmd88x2iwT2L.png?height=806&width=1370)

Whenever a trade happens in that range, this user collects 80% of the transaction fees proportionately. One thing worth pointing out is that USDC is the only asset you need to deposit to start market-making on Perp v2. Once you deposit some USDC, the system will mint the virtual tokens (0.1 vBTC and 4316.31 vUSD in the screenshot) you need to trade or market-make with.

## Risks and Rewards of Running Perp-maker

With perp-maker, anyone can automate their market-making strategy on Perp v2 to earn transaction fees and liquidity mining rewards *(more on this later)*.

**Out of the box, perp-maker lets you choose which market you want to provide liquidity to and within what price range**. As a reminder, if the market price moves out of the price range you set, you will not collect any transaction fees until it moves back in the range. **Perp-maker can automatically adjust your liquidity and realize the [impermanent loss](https://blog.perp.fi/what-is-impermanent-loss-a9b1359d56f3) when the market price reaches the price level you set.**

### But What is Impermanent Loss?

On Perp v2, makers act as the other side of each trade. If a trader makes a profit, a maker loses money. This loss is impermanent as it will become 0 when the market price returns to the initial price. Even if the market price moves away from the initial price, you can collect fees if the market price stays in the price range.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4T-vCemGHAoAu6SYZnmjR.png?height=1012&width=1908)

As a rule of thumb, **the wider the price range you set, the less [impermanent loss](https://blog.perp.fi/what-is-impermanent-loss-a9b1359d56f3) you suffer; however, the less transaction fees you can collect. And the more transaction fees generated on a market, the better for you as a maker.** You can use the [Perpetual Simulator](https://defi-lab-test-vhee9.ondigitalocean.app/perpetualsimulator) to simulate different price ranges in any given market to gauge the profitability of your strategy.

Additionally, **the developers behind the protocol provide its token, known as $PERP, as an extra reward to encourage more people to be makers**. This reward is distributed weekly proportional to the transaction fees you collect for that market. **This weekly reward is known as liquidity mining rewards.**

To recap - **if the transaction fees plus liquidity mining rewards outweigh the impermanent loss, it’s a profitable strategy**. If not, it can still be a profitable strategy over a more extended timeframe as it takes time for the combined value of the fees and liquidity mining rewards to catch up with the impermanent loss.

## Setting the Stage

*If you consider yourself an experienced programmer, you should have no problem setting up the bot using the readme in the [perp-maker](https://github.com/perpetual-protocol/perp-maker/) repo.*

In the previous sections, we learned how Perp v2 works and the risks and rewards of being a maker on the platform. This section will go through the steps to set up a perp-maker on your computer. You can join our Discord server where we have a [#coding-chat channel](https://discord.gg/M7y2VFqwCb) for questions you encounter when building on top of Perp v2.

First, you need to download and install [Node.JS](https://nodejs.org/en/download/) on your computer, which comes along with the Node Package Manager (npm) that we need.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6QOtvjcuMi36QkSCyQLfm.png?height=1062&width=1370)

Once installed, you can type the following commands in your terminal (Terminal for macOS or Command Prompt for Windows) to check both software versions on your computer:

`node -v`

`npm -v`

You should see similar responses on your screen, like the screenshot below. There might be some differences between your version and mine, but you’ll be fine if the npm version is at least seven and Node.js is at least 16.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/N4a5KHu_9C987ll57Uyxt.png?height=782&width=1370)

For Windows users, if you see an error message of “‘node’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,” you need to modify your Environment Variables. You can search “Environment Variables” on your PC and add the location where you installed Node.js in the PATH. My installed location is at “C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\”.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZqQ1j9QNzMjFhO46GrGPM.png?height=980&width=1024)

Then you need to install Git on your computer. You can visit [this site](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git) to see the install guide for each OS. For those who want to learn more about Git, you can watch [this 100 second video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hwP7WQkmECE) to know more about it. Once installed, type the following command in your terminal to verify it’s working:

`git --version`

*Again, for Windows users, if you run into an error that starts with “git is not recognized as an internal or external command…”, you need to edit your Environment Variables as we previously did for Node.js.*

Now, we will clone the perp-maker repo and build it locally. You can do it with the following commands in your terminal:

`git clone https://github.com/perpetual-protocol/perp-maker.git`

`cd perp-maker`

`npm i`

`npm run build`

If everything works properly, you should see something on your terminal that’s similar to what’s displayed below.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dIWmLkTfy6EDqLNK3H5On.png?height=496&width=1372)

The last thing in this section is that you need to download a cryptocurrency wallet. We recommend [MetaMask](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/metamask/nkbihfbeogaeaoehlefnkodbefgpgknn) as it’s the world’s most popular browser wallet. During onboarding, you’ll be asked to save 12 recovery phrases. You should **never** share these with anyone under any circumstances.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mBbPh3b35FiRWt5KwFPlY.png?height=808&width=1370)

## Configure the Bot: Local Variables and Strategy

At this point, we’re just a few adjustments away from running the bot locally.

### Modify .env file

You need to add a web3 endpoint and your wallet’s private key to the .env file in your perp-maker folder. Here is what it looks like once it’s done:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4-JyvjGUDUWHpm33uiKpm.png?height=872&width=1370)

**For a web3 endpoint, you can obtain it by creating a free account on [Infura](https://infura.io/) or [Alchemy](https://www.alchemy.com/).** For testing purposes, you should get an endpoint for “Optimism Kovan”, not “Optimism Mainnet” or “Kovan”.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/m4tW5ytUsE7qwyP66q3bt.png?height=802&width=1370)

*If you’re wondering what a web3 endpoint is, it’s where this bot submits your transaction. The endpoint provider e.g. Infura will broadcast your transaction to blockchain miners/validators upon reception, who will later validate your transaction and add it to the blockchain's latest block.*

**As for the private key, you can export it from your MetaMask** by clicking the more button *(besides your wallet address)*, clicking “Account details,” then “Export Private Key.” Similar to recovery phrases, you should never share your private key. It’s recommended that you use a new MetaMask account rather than the one that you’ve been using for trades.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sXTYNdQbm1Irp0oiHOB7l.png?height=1032&width=608)

### Modify config.json file

Next up, we need to modify the parameters in the config.json file, which sits in the configs subfolder of the src folder, to create our strategy.

Here are the parameters that you need to determine and the respective description in the config file:

* PRICE_CHECK_INTERVAL_SEC: The frequency to check the price in seconds.
* ADJUST_MAX_GAS_PRICE_GWEI: The maximum gas fee in Gwei which the bot will adjust liquidity. If the gas price exceeds this number, the liquidity won't be adjusted. Currently, the gas price on Optimism is fixed at 0.001 Gwei.
* IS_ENABLED: Set to \`true\` to enable this market.
* LIQUIDITY_AMOUNT:How much vUSD (after leverage) to provide as liquidity. Perp v2 supports up to 10x leverage, meaning that you can use up to 10x of your deposited USDC to provide liquidity.
* LIQUIDITY_RANGE_OFFSET: The offset to upper price and lower price of the liquidity range. For example, if it’s set to 0.05, it will provide liquidity from (current price / 1.05) to (current price \* 1.05).
* LIQUIDITY_ADJUST_THRESHOLD: The threshold that the bot will remove your existing liquidity, realize the impermanent loss, and place a new price range. For example, if it’s set to 0.01, the bot will remove your existing liquidity when the current price goes out of the range below (initial price/ 1.01) or above (the initial price\* 1.01), and subsequently provides liquidity with a new price range based on LIQUIDITY_RANGE_OFFSET and the current price.

We use vBTC *(BTC market)* and vPERP *(PERP market)* as the target markets in the config file by default. You can check the list of markets on Perp v2 from [the UI](https://app.perp.com/) or [this JSON file](https://metadata.perp.exchange/v2/optimism.json).

## Run Locally on Optimism Kovan (testnet)

You need to get some test tokens before running the bot on Optimism testnet. Head to [Optifaucet](https://kovan.optifaucet.com/), type in your wallet address *(which starts with 0x)* and send out the request.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/472eL25IaWpOqyc8sth44.png?height=718&width=1230)

*If you run out of the test ETH to pay for transactions, you can go to [Paradigm’s faucet](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/) to request more test ETH and then bridge them to Optimism Kovan via [Optimism Bridge](https://app.optimism.io/bridge).*

We’re almost ready! The bot by default is set to run on Optimism. To run on Optimism Kovan, you need to add an endpoint for the testnet (as demonstrated above) and comment *(add two “slashes” before the codes)* the two lines below in the index.ts file which is located in the src folder.

`// process.env["STAGE"] = "production"`

`// process.env["NETWORK"] = "optimism"`

For Windows users, you need to add additional two lines below above the `initLog()` in the index.ts file:

`import dotenv from "dotenv";`

`dotenv.config();`

If there is any error saying dotenv isn’t installed, you can run the command below in your terminal to [install dotenv](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dotenv):

`npm install dotenv --save`

Now, we’re all set! For macOS users, type the command below to run the bot locally:

`env $(cat .env | grep -v '#' | xargs) npm run start`

For Windows users, type the command below in your terminal to do it:

`npm start`

If it runs successfully, you should be able to see similar responses on your terminal:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4gcsUq-i2kMpXkbpk-f3d.png?height=372&width=1374)

Another way to validate if the template runs successfully is to check the target markets in the pool section on the UI. For testnet *(Optimism Kovan)*, please visit [testnet.perp.exchange](https://testnet.perp.exchange/); As for mainnet *(Optimism)*, visit [app.perp.com](https://app.perp.com/).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wTbtDlx5qj7XnJaxGMRs1.png?height=764&width=1374)

Alright! That’s all we have for today. Hope you have fun, or at least learned something in our journey. Stay tuned for part two! In the meantime, feel free to join our Discord server where we have a [#coding-chat channel](https://discord.gg/M7y2VFqwCb) dedicated to technical questions.

## Helpful Resources

* A third-party site to track your fees and APR: <https://www.seedle.finance/>
* Maker simulator for Perp v2: <https://defi-lab.xyz/perpetualsimulator>
* API for Perp v2: [https://thegraph.com/hosted-service/subgraph/perpetual-protocol/perpetual-v2-optimism?query=Get Trader](https://thegraph.com/hosted-service/subgraph/perpetual-protocol/perpetual-v2-optimism?query=Get%20Trader)
* Contract addresses on Perp v2: <https://metadata.perp.exchange/v2/optimism.json>
* Perp v2 documentation: <https://v2docs.perp.fi/>

At this point, we’re just a few adjustments away from running the bot locally.

### Modify .env file

You need to add a web3 endpoint and your wallet’s private key to the .env file in your perp-maker folder. Here is what it looks like once it’s done:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4-JyvjGUDUWHpm33uiKpm.png?height=872&width=1370)

**For a web3 endpoint, you can obtain it by creating a free account on [Infura](https://infura.io/) or [Alchemy](https://www.alchemy.com/).** For testing purposes, you should get an endpoint for “Optimism Kovan”, not “Optimism Mainnet” or “Kovan”.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/m4tW5ytUsE7qwyP66q3bt.png?height=802&width=1370)

*If you’re wondering what a web3 endpoint is, it’s where this bot submits your transaction. The endpoint provider e.g. Infura will broadcast your transaction to blockchain miners/validators upon reception, who will later validate your transaction and add it to the blockchain's latest block.*

**As for the private key, you can export it from your MetaMask** by clicking the more button *(besides your wallet address)*, clicking “Account details,” then “Export Private Key.” Similar to recovery phrases, you should never share your private key. It’s recommended that you use a new MetaMask account rather than the one that you’ve been using for trades.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sXTYNdQbm1Irp0oiHOB7l.png?height=1032&width=608)

### Modify config.json file

Next up, we need to modify the parameters in the config.json file, which sits in the configs subfolder of the src folder, to create our strategy.

Here are the parameters that you need to determine and the respective description in the config file:

* PRICE_CHECK_INTERVAL_SEC: The frequency to check the price in seconds.
* ADJUST_MAX_GAS_PRICE_GWEI: The maximum gas fee in Gwei which the bot will adjust liquidity. If the gas price exceeds this number, the liquidity won't be adjusted. Currently, the gas price on Optimism is fixed at 0.001 Gwei.
* IS_ENABLED: Set to \`true\` to enable this market.
* LIQUIDITY_AMOUNT:How much vUSD (after leverage) to provide as liquidity. Perp v2 supports up to 10x leverage, meaning that you can use up to 10x of your deposited USDC to provide liquidity.
* LIQUIDITY_RANGE_OFFSET: The offset to upper price and lower price of the liquidity range. For example, if it’s set to 0.05, it will provide liquidity from (current price / 1.05) to (current price \* 1.05).
* LIQUIDITY_ADJUST_THRESHOLD: The threshold that the bot will remove your existing liquidity, realize the impermanent loss, and place a new price range. For example, if it’s set to 0.01, the bot will remove your existing liquidity when the current price goes out of the range below (initial price/ 1.01) or above (the initial price\* 1.01), and subsequently provides liquidity with a new price range based on LIQUIDITY_RANGE_OFFSET and the current price.

We use vBTC *(BTC market)* and vPERP *(PERP market)* as the target markets in the config file by default. You can check the list of markets on Perp v2 from [the UI](https://app.perp.com/) or [this JSON file](https://metadata.perp.exchange/v2/optimism.json).

## Run Locally on Optimism Kovan (testnet)

You need to get some test tokens before running the bot on Optimism testnet. Head to [Optifaucet](https://kovan.optifaucet.com/), type in your wallet address *(which starts with 0x)* and send out the request.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/472eL25IaWpOqyc8sth44.png?height=718&width=1230)

*If you run out of the test ETH to pay for transactions, you can go to [Paradigm’s faucet](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/) to request more test ETH and then bridge them to Optimism Kovan via [Optimism Bridge](https://app.optimism.io/bridge).*

We’re almost ready! The bot by default is set to run on Optimism. To run on Optimism Kovan, you need to add an endpoint for the testnet (as demonstrated above) and comment *(add two “slashes” before the codes)* the two lines below in the index.ts file which is located in the src folder.

`// process.env["STAGE"] = "production"`

`// process.env["NETWORK"] = "optimism"`

For Windows users, you need to add additional two lines below above the `initLog()` in the index.ts file:

`import dotenv from "dotenv";`

`dotenv.config();`

If there is any error saying dotenv isn’t installed, you can run the command below in your terminal to [install dotenv](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dotenv):

`npm install dotenv --save`

Now, we’re all set! For macOS users, type the command below to run the bot locally:

`env $(cat .env | grep -v '#' | xargs) npm run start`

For Windows users, type the command below in your terminal to do it:

`npm start`

If it runs successfully, you should be able to see similar responses on your terminal:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4gcsUq-i2kMpXkbpk-f3d.png?height=372&width=1374)

Another way to validate if the template runs successfully is to check the target markets in the pool section on the UI. For testnet *(Optimism Kovan)*, please visit [testnet.perp.exchange](https://testnet.perp.exchange/); As for mainnet *(Optimism)*, visit [app.perp.com](https://app.perp.com/).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wTbtDlx5qj7XnJaxGMRs1.png?height=764&width=1374)

Alright! That’s all we have for today. Hope you have fun, or at least learned something in our journey. Stay tuned for part two! In the meantime, feel free to join our Discord server where we have a [#coding-chat channel](https://discord.gg/M7y2VFqwCb) dedicated to technical questions.

## Helpful Resources

* A third-party site to track your fees and APR: <https://www.seedle.finance/>
* Maker simulator for Perp v2: <https://defi-lab.xyz/perpetualsimulator>
* API for Perp v2: [https://thegraph.com/hosted-service/subgraph/perpetual-protocol/perpetual-v2-optimism?query=Get Trader](https://thegraph.com/hosted-service/subgraph/perpetual-protocol/perpetual-v2-optimism?query=Get%20Trader)
* Contract addresses on Perp v2: <https://metadata.perp.exchange/v2/optimism.json>
* Perp v2 documentation: <https://v2docs.perp.fi/>

title: HASH DAO Whitepaper
body:
**Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture ($HASH)**

**The World‘s First Cannabis DAO**

*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission**  

To cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution for craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOC communities interested in the cannabis space.

HASH DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's to create the world’s first DAO cannabis company and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAO Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

Funding for a successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal quality creates struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

*Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

HASH DAO : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

**Introduction**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering it’s boom phase as support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) grows and global cannabis markets continue to come online. The cannabis space is estimated to grow to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway. The majority of the craft cannabis industry, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the consumer, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly penalized small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in. Certain strains go on to become culturally iconic that generate massive value. Often times the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* Breeders, Growers, & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**How it Works**

Create community-ownership of the vertically-integrated HASH DAO supply chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. 

Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKU’s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

**Data Privacy & Security** 

Privacy is essential to any business. Surprisingly, it is almost nonexistent in the blockchain ecosystem. For example, Bitcoin started out with privacy as a goal but was subverted and now is very public by using [chain analytics companies](https://bitcoinist.com/yes-your-bitcoin-transactions-can-be-tracked-and-here-are-the-companies that-are-doing-it/.). It's like having your bank account available to the public where the public cannot access your money but they can see everything you are doing. The same is true of smart contract platforms like Ethereum. 

Hash DAO will use the most private smart contract platform soon-to-be available, [DERO](https://www.dero.com/). 

Bitcoin's privacy problem was solved by the cryptocurrency coin Monero. Similarly, Ethereum’s privacy problem is solved by the token DERO. 

Many blockchain projects, both cryptocurrency coins and and smart contract platforms using tokens, claim privacy but in fact are not. They offer a privacy option at best. This in fact defeats true privacy which only exists when the project offers *privacy by default at the protocol level*.

*ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)*

**World’s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

**HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : 

HASH DAO is an organization that is dedicated to creating a network of cannabis growers and educators. We aim to promote the use of horticulture, farming and natural medicine as a means for collective healing and wellness. A cannabis research, development and production partnership. This DAO will address both the intellectual property and craft standards of local microgrowers, processors, home growers and people interested in horticultural education as well as providing funding for research projects into genetic diversity and marijuana's medicinal applications.

Another utility is that HASH DAO is a tokenized equity fundraising tool. HASH DAO's mission is to become a community-governed organization tasked with helping small companies fund themselves and achieve liquidity. A decentralized community-governance solution for HASH DAO that includes a market-driven, tokenized oracle for the  liquidity, yield-farming and major-user decisions.

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> “Community Ownership of Physical and Digital Assets”

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial HASH DAO treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Mac’s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and it’s production on-chain, from SKU NFT’s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Mac’s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Mac’s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFT’s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build “Metaverse farms” and “digital dispensaries” where a user can view the product, find out all of it’s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, we’ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Mac’s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKU’s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephew’s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities Program to co-create HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephew’s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

**Opportunity**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QcqQLT4DyBHuQRaaputgr.png?height=560&width=997)

title: Introducing RAW Reflections
body:
Welcome to **RAW Reflections**, a publication about photographic art in the strange new world of NFTs.

Sounds simple enough, but there's a few interesting things we wouldn't want you to miss from behind the scenes.

So please, grab a seat while we go through the peculiar context in which RAW Review was born — it'll be useful to acquaint ourselves as we start this journey.

## What's RAW?

RAW is the uncompressed format in which digital photography is first rendered.

As light passes through the lens and aperture of a modern camera, photons hit the sensor, inducing subtle electric currents that get recorded in memory as a RAW image file, uncompressed and exactly as the sensor first saw it. These image files are converted and go through a process of refinement before they reach their final stage, ready to be shared with the world.

It also describes the state of the NFT photography market in which *RAW DAO*, the organization, was formed: undeveloped, intractable, inefficient — but also, ready to be sculpted into something great and shared with the world.

The dawn of NFT technology allowed for the formation of new markets, in particular for art and culture. We've since witnessed remarkable growth in the creation and commercialization of NFT art, mainly in computer-native expressions such as generative or programmable art.

The application of this is obvious for photography. Contemporary photos are fully digital entities, and are thus plagued with the same issues that once cursed the music industry: easy duplication and sharing, no digital ownership.

NFTs solve this exact issue—digital scarcity—while also offering many convenient amenities for collectors, such as a frictionless marketplace experience through Opensea and other dapps, where one can track the entire provenance of an artwork or collection. 
 

![Delphine Diallo — Divine, Malick Sidibe's Camera](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pMD-n55VVO19EaP3EWGwd.jpg?height=433&width=600)

## The NFT Photography Market

While the technological foundation is laid down and commercialization of NFT photography is already up and running, the intellectual and curatorial landscape that is necessary in any art market is still in its infancy.

The high degree of subjectivity, characteristic of contemporary art, exacerbates the need for curatorial figures to build consensus on what should be considered valuable.

Not all art can be valuable—the same way that not all music can be popular—and so collectors, often motivated by the prospect of financial gains, latch on to whatever quality signals they can identify.

And what better signal than the carefully sculpted opinions of experts and pundits? 
  
 The ethos of web3 might have something to say about that. Such a level of centralization of influence doesn't fly well in a market born from the disruptive and decentralization-obsessed world of cryptocurrency. 
  
 Enter RAW DAO: a *Decentralized Autonomous Organization* dedicated to identifying, collecting, and promoting the best that NFT photography has to offer.

![Chadwick Tyler — God's People 0067](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/p5Tt0LcJ1FoAFlIF6VotN.jpg?height=2000&width=3000)

## How does RAW DAO work?

RAW DAO began as an incubation funded by [Fingerprints DAO](https://fingerprintsdao.xyz), a major collector and lighthouse of blockchain NFT art. Its founding members include renowned artists such as Justin Aversano, Alejandro Cartagena, Michelle Viljoen, and many others, along with major collectors and web3 builders.

Part of the funding for the organization came through the public auctioning of Justin Aversano's Twin Flames #49 via PartyBid, titled the "[Community Twin.](https://www.partybid.app/party/0x2e213d57f5ff7209dec3c522aa01779596d08f19)" Bidders received fractions of the artwork and proportional $RAW tokens, in what became one of the most valuable photography sales of all time.

![Justin Aversano's Twin Flames #49 — "The Community Twin", auctioned for about US$3.3mm](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0KFCi6cO9ORfETwVD4DS8.jpg?height=512&width=512)

Being a DAO means all major decisions are settled by our community of tokenholders.

Anyone can acquire $RAW tokens and become a member of RAW DAO, enabling them to vote on governance decisions about how the organization is run and how the treasury is spent.

Via this mechanism, RAW members have created a system of [decentralized curation](https://snapshot.org/#/rawdao.eth/proposal/0x4eb7766e68116f0d184e6a5bcbc18bc7ffba74fdc5050928ffb6cd089cfd4507), where works of NFT photography are nominated by the community, reviewed, discussed, voted on, and eventually acquired.

In its current iteration, the top 3 voted collections are acquired every month, establishing a high bar for what works are allowed to join the [RAW collection](https://rawdao.xyz/gallery).

RAW members are provided a space where they can mingle and discuss artworks in Discord, contribute to the work that is required to sustain the organization, and can be compensated for it in a novel and [decentralized compensation system](https://snapshot.org/#/rawdao.eth/proposal/0x12e284f4598f60cf37667c9a69b8930d12ac5f88b45b95c66b2537ec540de628).

In its current iteration, RAW is divided in thematic working groups such as governance, marketing, and finance, and all members are allowed to work in whatever areas they choose. At the end of each month, members gather and vote for each other, splitting compensation budgets according to their perceived contribution.

The balanced and unique mix of artists, collectors, and enthusiasts makes the RAW community truly unique in the NFT photography space: a hotspot for the curatorial and intellectual discussions necessary to move the market from its "raw" form to a more sophisticated and evolved version.

![Carlo Van de Roer — September 20: Set 1 #1 — The piece which inspired RAW's logo.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ss_WovuG92gxhNrVC5Nh-.jpg?height=730&width=600)

## How to join?

Becoming a member of RAW requires jumping through a few hoops for the crypto-uninitiated, but summarized instructions are available [in our website](https://www.rawdao.xyz/join).

If you are passionate about photography, art or the possibilities of web3.0, we'll be here waiting to welcome you to our community.

Make sure to bring your camera! 📸

Until then, we'll see you in the next issue of RAW Reflections. 👋

title: Building Web3 Commerce
body:
## How might Web3 change the status quo in commerce?

Commerce will move to a wallet-centric experience.

Brands will access a new toolbox to create really meaningful, intricate interactions with their customers.

## Before we dive in, what gives Web3 an edge?

* The composability of NFTs open up a *one-to-many world*: brands share audiences, collaboration and multi-player commerce.
* NFTs provide a new layer of social context which brands can tap into from the public ledger.
* Differentiation of the interaction: bespoke, crafted, surprising.

## Token-gating

* Access a “secret” store front with a membership NFT.
* Access (verified) drops, flash sales, events, and other perks.

## Collabs

* Build your audience through other brands. Like a band, you play concerts with other bands and tap into their like-minded audience to grow your following.
* Token-gating of audience X on the site of complementary brand Y
* Airdrops as the new marketing flyer (can also be intrusive).

## Multi-player commerce

* Go on a shopping spree with your friends. Multi-sig shopping.
* Assemble NFTs to access group perks

## Products

* Mint a NFT and receive a (authentic) luxury item
* Buy one, give one model. Buy 2 NFTs and 1 is donated (or equivalent goods / money)

## Customer ownership

* Customers vote on and propose brand decisions: next collection, collabs, etc.
* Stake NFT for funding working capital

## Loyalty

* Community membership: connect with other customers (NFT DAO)
* Community-owned events and products (derivative products, fan fiction, etc.)
* Membership unlocks a premium tier of experiences instead of loyalty2.0 discounts

## IRL personalization

* Sign in at the store with a NFT, unlock the premium experience or a secret room, etc.

## Payments

* Faster and cheaper settlement than Stripe
* On-chain revenue and cash balance ⇒ on-chain lending
* Import real world assets on-chain; borrow against them for higher capital efficiency

## Wallet Portability

* Not specifically an opportunity for commerce, but the ability to have my wallet on hand anywhere is great. Commerce is happening on a growing number of channels, which requires ubiquitous payments and wallets: on a website, at the store, on social media, in virtual reality, at events, etc.
* Wallets can easily be ported across channels (mobile, desktop, mobile, IRL).
* What is this useful for? (think deeper)

title: HASH DAO Whitepaper
body:
**Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture ($HASH)**

**The World‘s First Cannabis DAO**

*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission**  

Engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects and BIPOC-equity.

To cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution for craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOC communities interested in the cannabis space.

HASH DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's to create the world’s first DAO cannabis company and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAO Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

Funding for a successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal quality creates struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

*Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

HASH DAO : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

**Introduction**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering it’s boom phase as support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) grows and global cannabis markets continue to come online. The cannabis space is estimated to grow to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway. The majority of the craft cannabis industry, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the consumer, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly penalized small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in. Certain strains go on to become culturally iconic that generate massive value. Often times the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* Breeders, Growers, & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**How it Works**

Create community-ownership of the vertically-integrated HASH DAO supply chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. 

Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKU’s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

> *ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)*

**Data Privacy & Security** 

Privacy is essential to any business. Surprisingly, it is almost nonexistent in the blockchain ecosystem. For example, Bitcoin started out with privacy as a goal but was subverted and now is very public by using [chain analytics companies](https://bitcoinist.com/yes-your-bitcoin-transactions-can-be-tracked-and-here-are-the-companies that-are-doing-it/.). It's like having your bank account available to the public where the public cannot access your money but they can see everything you are doing. The same is true of smart contract platforms like Ethereum. 

Hash DAO will use the most private smart contract platform soon-to-be available, [DERO](https://www.dero.com/). 

Bitcoin's privacy problem was solved by the cryptocurrency coin Monero. Similarly, Ethereum’s privacy problem is solved by the token DERO. 

Many blockchain projects, both cryptocurrency coins and and smart contract platforms using tokens, claim privacy but in fact are not. They offer a privacy option at best. This in fact defeats true privacy which only exists when the project offers *privacy by default at the protocol level*.

**World’s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

Engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects and BIPOC-equity.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

**HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : 

HASH DAO is an organization that is dedicated to creating a network of cannabis growers and educators. We aim to promote the use of horticulture, farming and natural medicine as a means for collective healing and wellness. A cannabis research, development and production partnership. This DAO will address both the intellectual property and craft standards of local microgrowers, processors, home growers and people interested in horticultural education as well as providing funding for research projects into genetic diversity and marijuana's medicinal applications.

Another utility is that HASH DAO is a tokenized equity fundraising tool. HASH DAO's mission is to become a community-governed organization tasked with helping small companies fund themselves and achieve liquidity. A decentralized community-governance solution for HASH DAO that includes a market-driven, tokenized oracle for the  liquidity, yield-farming and major-user decisions.

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> “Community Ownership of Physical and Digital Assets”

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial HASH DAO treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Mac’s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and it’s production on-chain, from SKU NFT’s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Mac’s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Mac’s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFT’s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build “Metaverse farms” and “digital dispensaries” where a user can view the product, find out all of it’s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, we’ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Mac’s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKU’s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephew’s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities Program to co-create HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephew’s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

**Opportunity**

title: HASH DAO Whitepaper
body:
**Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture ($HASH)**

**The World‘s First Cannabis DAO**

*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission**  

Engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects and BIPOC-equity.

To cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution for craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOC communities interested in the cannabis space.

HASH DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's to create the world’s first DAO cannabis company and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAO Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

Funding for a successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal quality creates struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

*Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

HASH DAO : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

**Introduction**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering it’s boom phase as support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) grows and global cannabis markets continue to come online. The cannabis space is estimated to grow to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway. The majority of the craft cannabis industry, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the consumer, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly penalized small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in. Certain strains go on to become culturally iconic that generate massive value. Often times the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* Breeders, Growers, & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**How it Works**

Create community-ownership of the vertically-integrated HASH DAO supply chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. 

Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKU’s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

> *ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)*

**Data Privacy & Security** 

Privacy is essential to any business. Surprisingly, it is almost nonexistent in the blockchain ecosystem. For example, Bitcoin started out with privacy as a goal but was subverted and now is very public by using [chain analytics companies](https://bitcoinist.com/yes-your-bitcoin-transactions-can-be-tracked-and-here-are-the-companies that-are-doing-it/.). It's like having your bank account available to the public where the public cannot access your money but they can see everything you are doing. The same is true of smart contract platforms like Ethereum. 

Hash DAO will use the most private smart contract platform soon-to-be available, [DERO](https://www.dero.com/). 

Bitcoin's privacy problem was solved by the cryptocurrency coin Monero. Similarly, Ethereum’s privacy problem is solved by the token DERO. 

Many blockchain projects, both cryptocurrency coins and and smart contract platforms using tokens, claim privacy but in fact are not. They offer a privacy option at best. This in fact defeats true privacy which only exists when the project offers *privacy by default at the protocol level*.

**World’s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

Engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects and BIPOC-equity.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

**HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : 

HASH DAO is an organization that is dedicated to creating a network of cannabis growers and educators. We aim to promote the use of horticulture, farming and natural medicine as a means for collective healing and wellness. A cannabis research, development and production partnership. This DAO will address both the intellectual property and craft standards of local microgrowers, processors, home growers and people interested in horticultural education as well as providing funding for research projects into genetic diversity and marijuana's medicinal applications.

Another utility is that HASH DAO is a tokenized equity fundraising tool. HASH DAO's mission is to become a community-governed organization tasked with helping small companies fund themselves and achieve liquidity. A decentralized community-governance solution for HASH DAO that includes a market-driven, tokenized oracle for the  liquidity, yield-farming and major-user decisions.

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> “Community Ownership of Physical and Digital Assets”

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial HASH DAO treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Mac’s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and it’s production on-chain, from SKU NFT’s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Mac’s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Mac’s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFT’s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build “Metaverse farms” and “digital dispensaries” where a user can view the product, find out all of it’s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, we’ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Mac’s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKU’s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephew’s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities Program to co-create HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephew’s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

title: Manual Operativo del Optimism Collective (v.0.1.1)
body:
*Este documento describe el proceso actual de las propuestas de gobernanza del Optimism Collective. Evolucionará, junto al Collective, con el tiempo.*

## Token House y los holders de OP

La gobernanza en el Optimism Collective comienza con el lanzamiento de la Token House y sus miembros, los holders de OP.

Cómo miembros de la Token House, los holders de OP son responsables de la sumisión, deliberación y votación en los distintos tipos de propuestas de gobernanza del Optimism Collective.

Llevando adelante estas funciones, los holders de OP podrán votar con sus OP directamente, o delegar el poder de voto de sus OP a un tercero elegible.

Token House es solo la primera parte de la [estructura de la gobernanza](https://mirror.xyz/0x3e4865634EC54dFF742E1a7452a456919B8e277b/vqqC7BJqLGuFttA2vYpy-QyJrmoI_-X9LwCffd6Lb6c) de Optimism Collective. Próximamente se inaugurará la Cámara de los Ciudadanos y este Manual Operativo se actualizará en consecuencia.

### Kit de herramientas de gobernanza

Las dos herramientas principales para la gobernanza de Optimism Collective son:

* **Snapshot:** donde todas las propuestas de gobernanza de Token House se envían a votación.
* **[Foro de Optimism:](https://gov.optimism.io/)** Una plataforma de discusión y deliberación sobre propuestas de gobernanza.

### Proceso de propuesta: componentes de una propuesta válida

El ciclo de vida de una propuesta de gobernanza de Token House consta de cuatro fases: **(1)** feedback; **(2)** presentación; **(3)** votación; y **(4)** implementación. Cada fase y sus requisitos asociados se describen a continuación.

### 1 . Feedback

Cualquiera que envíe una propuesta debe hacer un esfuerzo por recopilar feedback de los delegados y la comunidad antes de enviar una propuesta para votación. Hay dos vías principales para el feedback:

**a.** Para feedback ligero o temprano, los autores pueden publicar una propuesta (o una versión abreviada de su propuesta) en el canal **#gov-temp-check** en [Discord](https://discord-gateway.optimism.io/). Este canal está abierto a toda la comunidad de Optimism y puede usarse como una manera fácil de obtener un control rápido de la temperatura.

**b.** Para obtener un feedback formal de los participantes de la gobernanza, los autores pueden publicar una propuesta en el Foro con una etiqueta **\[DRAFT\]** en el título. Esto indica que su propuesta está lista para recibir comentarios de los delegados de Token House. Todos los comentarios de estos dos foros no son vinculantes, pero se espera que los proponentes participen de buena fe. Este paso está diseñado para ayudar a elaborar propuestas reflexivas y efectivas.

Después de incorporar los comentarios, el autor de la propuesta puede eliminar **\[DRAFT\]** del título de la propuesta y avanzar en el envío de la propuesta.

### 2 . Presentación

Para ser elegible para votar, OP holders o su delegado debe presentar una propuesta de gobernanza válida en Token House. Esto significa que la propuesta debe ser:

* Un tipo de propuesta válida. Todas las propuestas de gobernanza v0.1 deben estar dentro de una de las siguientes categorías:
  * Fondo de Gobernanza (Fase 0 o Fase 1)
  * Actualización de protocolo
  * Ajuste por inflación
  * Destitución de un director
  * Asignaciones del Treasury
  * Protecciones de derechos

  Para obtener una descripción más detallada de cada tipo de propuesta, consulte "Proceso de propuesta: por tipo de propuesta" a continuación.
* **Correctamente formateado a la plantilla aplicable.** Cada Tipo de Propuesta tendrá una Plantilla específica asociada en el Foro. Antes de la presentación, el autor de una propuesta debe ajustar su propuesta al formato de la Plantilla aplicable en todos los aspectos materiales. Esto incluirá, por el momento, el requisito de que todas las presentaciones se realicen en inglés.
* **Aprobado por al menos un delegado.** En el transcurso de la discusión y el feedback, al menos un Delegado con más del 0,0005 % de los votos debe indicar que cree que la propuesta está lista para votar. Con el espíritu de minimizar la gobernanza, este documento no codificará un mecanismo de aprobación explícito, pero esperará que los miembros de la comunidad lo interpreten de manera adecuada.
* **Sometida formalmente a votación.** Una semana antes del inicio de cada ciclo de votación, la Fundación iniciará un hilo de Envío de Período de Votación en el Foro. Para enviar formalmente una propuesta para votación, el autor de la propuesta debe **(a)** actualizar el título de su propuesta para comenzar **\[READY\]** o **(b)** agregar un enlace a este hilo de envío del período de votación que apunte a su propuesta en el foro. Al comienzo del próximo Período de Votación, Optimism Foundation enviará todas las propuestas válidas marcadas como listas a Snapshot para votación.

Las propuestas enviadas deben cumplir con todos los criterios anteriores para ser consideradas válidas. Las propuestas no válidas serán descartadas.

Cualquiera que envíe una propuesta puede enviar una versión preliminar de la propuesta para recibir comentarios en el Optimism Forum. Para hacerlo, inclúya **\[Draft\]** en el título de su foro y luego actualice el título de la propuesta una vez que el cuerpo de la propuesta esté finalizado.

### 3 . Votación

Para minimizar los gastos generales, todas las votaciones se realizan en Snapshot a intervalos regulares llamados **períodos de votación**. Los períodos de votación comienzan cada jueves a las 7 p. m. GMT y finalizan 1 semana y 6 días después, el miércoles siguiente a las 7 p. m. GMT. Los tipos de propuestas pueden requerir uno o más períodos de votación antes de que se pueda llegar a una resolución para votar.

Una propuesta en la gobernanza de Token House solo se aprobará si cumple con los siguientes umbrales mínimos de votos:

* **Quórum:** El número mínimo de votos OP totales requeridos para ser emitidos en relación con una propuesta. *Aquí, el quórum se mide como un % del supply total de OP votable.*
  * El supply total de OP votable se determinará en función de una estimación razonable proporcionada por Optimism Foundation antes de cada período de votación.
* **Umbral de aprobación:** El número mínimo de votos OP requeridos para ser emitidos a favor de aprobar una propuesta. El umbral de aprobación de cada propuesta se mide como *un % de votos emitidos para aprobar (en relación con el número total de votos emitidos en relación con) una propuesta.*

**Se tomará un snapshot para determinar el poder de voto** de cada delegado o titular de OP al comienzo de un período de votación determinado.

Según el Tipo de Propuesta, los requisitos exactos de quórum y umbral de aprobación pueden variar.

### 4 . Implementación

Las propuestas que sean rechazadas por invalidez o apoyo insuficiente pueden volver a presentarse. Las propuestas aprobadas se envían a Optimism Foundation para su implementación, como se describe más detalladamente en la sección "Implementación y administración" a continuación.

## Proceso de propuesta: ciclo de vida

Si bien los detalles de una propuesta de gobernanza de Token House en particular pueden variar según el tipo de propuesta, el ciclo de vida de una propuesta generalmente se verá así:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3GkOaH7SZPhCQHwde_7Jr.png?height=627&width=1920&size=medium)

## Proceso de propuesta: por tipo de propuesta

Los diferentes requisitos para la presentación y aprobación de cada Tipo de Propuesta se resumen a continuación.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pdurp0Jj9dzoZn_iFJYF9.png?height=1882&width=821&size=medium)

## Implementación y Administración

En todos los casos, la gobernanza del Optimism Collective pretende llevarse a cabo de conformidad con los términos de su [Constitución de Trabajo](https://gov.optimism.io/t/working-constitution-of-the-optimism-collective/55/23?u=axlvaz), el espíritu de su [Código de Conducta](https://gov.optimism.io/t/code-of-conduct/5/3) y la búsqueda de su [Visión Optimista](https://mirror.xyz/0x3e4865634EC54dFF742E1a7452a456919B8e277b/G-Ss-W78Vfrckz2MkHHnWiB7wFaH2D5nsbh6KE5c050). The Optimism Foundation administrará este proceso como se describe a continuación.

### Administración

The Optimism Foundation facilitará la administración de los procedimientos de gobernanza descritos en este Manual operativo con el objetivo de garantizar que los OP holders puedan participar de manera eficiente y efectiva en la gobernanza de Token House. Dichos servicios administrativos pueden incluir:

* Moderación de las propuestas de gobernanza para garantizar que se presenten y voten válidamente;
* Eliminación de propuestas que parezcan razonablemente fraudulentas, orientadas a correos no deseados, difamatorias, odiosas o inapropiadas o inconsistentes con los valores del Colectivo;
* Supervisión de los votos, el suministro de tokens votables y los períodos de votación con el fin de determinar si se cumplen los quórumes y los umbrales de aprobación;
* Gestión de propuestas contradictorias entre sí que se presentan simultáneamente o muy cerca unas de otras;
* Administración del mantenimiento de la red, como corrección de errores de emergencia o reversión de versiones (con o sin voto de gobierno); y
* Las demás que la Fundación estime convenientes en relación con las anteriores.

### Implementación

Las propuestas de gobernanza de Token House aprobadas se enviarán a Optimism Foundation para su implementación.

Al recibir una propuesta aprobada, Optimism Foundation determinará si la propuesta es segura, consistente con los propósitos de la Fundación y el Colectivo, y si se puede implementar de manera legalmente compatible.

* En caso afirmativo, la Fundación actuará con diligencia y de forma comercialmente razonable para que la propuesta se lleve a cabo.
* De no ser así, la Fundación puede eliminar la propuesta para volver a presentarla o hacer que la propuesta se implemente con ciertas medidas de seguridad, a su discreción, y junto con una explicación al Colectivo de por qué la propuesta fue rechazada o limitada.

La Optimism Foundation emprenderá este trabajo ministerial con miras a descentralizar cada vez más su papel con el tiempo.

## Enmiendas

Los procedimientos descritos en este Manual operativo entrarán en vigencia en el momento del Airdrop #1 y se ajustarán más adelante en relación con una serie de experimentos de gobernanza. Estos cambios incluyen, entre otros, la introducción de la Cámara de los Ciudadanos y la adición, eliminación y modificación de Tipos de propuestas y reglas relacionadas con los procesos de votación. Cualquier actualización no administrativa del Manual de operaciones se reflejará con un nuevo número de versión en la parte superior de este documento, momento en el que entrará en vigencia la versión actualizada.

title: Signs of Greatness
body:
What makes a founder truly great? I am no expert, just a founder spending a lot of times with other founders.

Here is, what I have come to believe are the attributes of the very best - say top 5% - founders and builders (product managers, engineers, designers, etc.) I've had the privilege to observe in action. 

**7 attributes stand out to me:**

1. **Self-actualizing:** Be willing to fail more, try new things, take more risks, take on new skills and be willing to suck for a prolonged of time. Self-awareness put in motion. 
2. **Resilient:** Come out of dark holes sooner and faster. Be able to let go of what’s hindering mentally and focus on bouncing back.
3. **Consistent.** Hone their craft every day. Grind, day in day out. Relentless.
4. **Competitive. I**nner fire to win, 24/7.
5. **Thinks independently**. Question everything, even the obvious stuff. Not subject to seeking social validation.
6. **Truth-seeking.** Pokes at own ideas.
7. **Curious and fast-learning.** Plenty of hacks to extract good intel quickly. Good sense for the right questions to ask.
8. **Generous. W**illing to teach and to show a vulnerable side. Take ownership for the team, especially in hard times.
